name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, some netizens have discovered that various places have begun to conduct militia drone skills training.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 11, Howard, a former NBA star who is loved by Chinese fans, co-produced a promotional video with Lai Ching-te, the Vice President of the Republic of China and Chairman of the Democratic Progressive Party of Taiwan. In the video, Howard called Taiwan a "country" and invited everyone to "stay at the Presidential Palace for a night."
As soon as the video was released, it immediately aroused strong dissatisfaction among mainland netizens, and a large number of netizens went to Howard's Weibo comment area to protest.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
The Chinese Embassy in the Central African Republic issued a consular security alert on May 6, saying that in recent days, there have been a number of armed attacks, kidnappings, intimidation and other security incidents targeting Chinese companies and citizens in the provinces of the Central African Republic, causing casualties and property losses.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
May 11, Sichuan University
In protest of Sichuan University's recent announcement to convert some male toilets into female toilets, a boy wore a Ding Zhen mask on campus and distributed male diapers to his classmates for free, and was then taken away by the security guards who rushed over.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Subsequent supplement
On the 12th, Howard responded and apologized at an event, saying that when he mentioned the word "country", he did not necessarily mean "country", and that he respected all Chinese and Taiwanese.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Subsequent supplement
A schoolmate asked the teacher for confirmation and received a reply that the content of the original picture 3 was untrue, and the protesters were only interviewed and not punished.
The chat records may have been forged by netizens on the forum.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
"Serious snow"
Recently, the official account of the Xingtai Cyberspace Administration of Hebei Province released a message saying that the Shahe City Cyberspace Administration and the public security department jointly interviewed a netizen who published false information.
It is reported that on the morning of May 6, Niu posted a video on his Douyin account "Mr.牜" titled "Is it snowing there?" The video showed that it was snowing somewhere, and the text "Shahe City, Hebei Province" was attached.
After the inspection and verification by the Cyberspace Administration, it was found that Shahe did not snow that day, and the information was seriously untrue. The Shahe City Cyberspace Administration attached great importance to it and jointly carried out investigation and disposal work with the public security department.
Through the interview, Niu said that he had realized the seriousness of his mistakes and problems, and would resolutely obey the disposal decision, and promised to strictly abide by relevant laws and regulations in the future to prevent such problems from happening again.
